name: Hard 11.6 "Teaching with the Enemy" Quiz / Test | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who did Sam hire as a bouncer?
questions.explanation:
Tiny.

	Tiny was played by Donald Gibb. Gibb, a 6'4" tall man, was born in 1954 in New York City.

questions.text: What word did Cliff teach the bouncer?
questions.explanation:
Juxtaposition.

	He said that calling a big man Tiny was a juxtaposition. He said "it's like calling a fat guy Slim or a bald guy Curly."

questions.text: For how many years have Frasier and Lilith been married in this episode?
questions.explanation:
7.

	Rebecca saw Lilith making out in her car. She asked after seven years of marriage how they kept the marriage so hot.

questions.text: When Lilith said she was saying goodbye to the man what did Rebecca say?
questions.correct: He must have been hard of hearing - you had his ear in your mouth.
options: He must have been hard of hearing - you had his ear in your mouth.
That was one heck of a good-bye.
You must care about him very much because it took a long time.
He seemed like he took it well.
questions.explanation:
He must have been hard of hearing - you had his ear in your mouth.

	Rebecca was very shocked to find out Lilith had an affair. Lilith said it wouldn't happen again.

questions.text: How long did Rebecca say she had until she "blows"?
questions.explanation:
1 hour.

	She told Lilith that she didn't know how she was going to keep the news to herself. Then she told her she knew it was wrong to tell the others but, "that's just me."

questions.text: How much did the bouncer think minimum wage was?
questions.explanation:
$2/hour.

	Minimum wage was somewhere between $8-$9 in 1993 in Massachusetts. Woody thought minimum wage was $2.50 an hour.

questions.correct: He held up a Piggly Wiggly.
questions.explanation:
He held up a Piggly Wiggly.

	He asked the others, "Can I now get on with my life, please?" Piggly Wiggly was a type of convenience store.

questions.text: Lilith wanted to tell Frasier her news at home but Frasier insisted she tell him while still at Cheers. Frasier decided to think of the worst possible thing Lilith could tell him. What did he think of?
questions.explanation:
Lilith had an affair.

	When it was out he said "That was it!" He called Lilith "a slut" and then ran out of the bar angrily.

questions.text: Who did Lilith have an affair with?
questions.explanation:
Lewis Pascal.

	Frasier said, "The bald guy!" Lilith said she didn't mean to hurt him.

questions.text: What did Frasier tell Lilith she had to do to save their marriage?
questions.correct: Tell the man she had an affair with that she'd never see him again.
options: Tell the man she had an affair with that she was moving to Chicago.
Go home and make passionate love to him (him being Frasier).
Go to the man's house and beat him up.
questions.explanation:
Tell the man she had an affair with that she'd never see him again.

	Lilith tried to tell Pascal it was over. However, they decided they were in love and she was leaving Frasier for Pascal.
